thread.title: Valentine’s Day on the cheap: $5 treat for your lover
thread.title_full: Valentine’s Day on the cheap: $5 treat for your lover

title: Valentine’s Day on the cheap: $5 treat for your lover
text:
Restaurant bookings up as lovers splurge on Valentine’s Day February 14, 2017 10:01am Will Goldsworthy, 23, and Ellyce Lambert, 22, celebrating their first Valentine's together at Bacchus. Picture: Mark Cranitch. Anooska Tucker-Evans The Courier-Mail Share on Twitter 
GOT a lover but love your cash just as much? Here are a range of Valentine’s Day treats to spoil your loved one — from cheap as chips to high-end dining. 
Some loved-up couples will be splashing out well over $100 per person on multi-course menus, with high end restaurants across Brisbane reporting strong bookings — some up 10 per cent on last year. 
Brisbane riverside Japanese eatery Sake is one such venture, with diners forking out $110 for their seven-course dinner with champagne. 
“Despite the lure of a more casual dining scene across Brisbane, when romance is in the air customers are still willing to splurge on that special someone,” said Rockpool Dining Group CEO Thomas Pash, which are behind Sake. 
It’s a similar story at South Brisbane fine diner Bacchus at Rydges hotel, which has sold out its $169 a head dinner tonight, following a flurry of last-minute bookings over the weekend. 
“It started out a little bit slowly, but we just put it down to the fact that it’s fallen on a Tuesday night this year,” Rydges executive chef Dominic Rose said. Year one students tell us what love is all about 1:50 
We asked these Year 1 students, Charlotte, Ava, Ewan and Logan, about what love is, what they think Valentine's Day is about and who the most important people are in their life. February 13th 2017 a day ago /video/video.news.com.au/Lifestyle/ 
“We’re also holding really strong bookings for Friday and Saturday, so I wonder if people are holding off on the Tuesday and are celebrating into the weekend so they don’t have to worry about going to work on the Wednesday.” 
Brisbane’s Will Goldsworthy, 23, and girlfriend Ellyce Lambert, 22, have chosen Bacchus to celebrate their first Valentine’s Day together tonight and said money was no concern. 
“We actually met in Soleil pool bar at Rydges so I thought why not bring it back to where it started,” Mr Goldsworthy said. 
“Plus I’ve heard there’s a new Michelin-starred chef here so I thought it would be good.” 
But for the cheapskate lover, Fratelli Famous Pizzeria will be serving special Nutella pizzas for just $5, and expect to sell more than 50 of the sweet creations and in excess of 400 regular pizzas at their Eagle Street Pier outlet. 
Venues are also trying to appeal to those without a loved one this year, with Bavarian Bier Cafe offering a “Dates with Mates” menu, designed to capture “the single bloke economy”, Mr Pash said. 
While Stingray Lounge at Surfers Paradise on the Gold Coast is doing an “Anti Valentine’s Day” event with $3 tacos and a DJ for single folk. 
Cold Rock Ice Creamery has taken the idea one step further launching their “Eat Your Feelings” ice cream range, where customers can break up with their current squeeze using a signature message in an ice cream cake like “You’re dumped”, “Love Stinks — Just like you” and “It’s not me, it’s you”, with the recipient then able to “eat their feelings”.
